article_title: U.S. Productivity Fell 3.2% in First Quarter, More Than Initially Thought
article_text:
The productivity of U.S. workers declined in the first quarter at the fastest pace in six years, further evidence of the miserable winter's toll on the economy and the latest manifestation of a broad slowdown in efficiency gains.

Nonfarm labor productivity, or output per hour worked, fell at a 3.2% seasonally adjusted annual rate during the first three months of 2014, the Labor Department said Wednesday. The agency last month, in an...
